examples.sentence: Ha! I finally solved this math problem after 3 hours!
Ha! You thought I'd forget your birthday?
Ha! This meme is so relatable!
Ha! I knew you'd eat the last dumpling!
Ha ha! Your imitation of our teacher is spot-on!
Ha ha! The cat just photobombed our selfie!
Ha ha! Your dance moves look like a robot with low battery!
The haberdasher hand-stitched bow ties for James Bond movies.
My grandfather bought his first trilby hat from a Jewish haberdasher in Shanghai.
The village haberdasher sold everything from needles to licorice.
In Dickens' novels, haberdashers often appear as comic relief characters.
The Sherlock Holmes Museum still maintains a Victorian-style haberdasher's shop.
The vintage haberdashery still sells silk ties from the 1920s.
He bought a pocket square at the haberdashery for his wedding.
Victorian haberdasheries sold everything from thimbles to tea leaves.
The haberdashery near the dock supplies sailors with odd necessities.
My habit of checking WeChat Moments right after waking up is hard to break.
Drinking hot water is a uniquely Chinese habit that puzzles foreigners.
His midnight snack habit makes him the best customer of Meituan delivery guys.
Collecting limited edition milk tea cups has become an expensive habit.
The sleeping habits of pandas inspired the design of lazy sofas.
Cats' habit of knocking things off tables annoys and amuses netizens.
The nun was habited in traditional black robes.
In historical dramas, actors are carefully habited to match the era.
I automatically reached for my phone out of force of habit.
He finally kicked the habit of biting nails after 20 years.

examples.sentence: Scientists are searching for habitable planets with bubble tea resources.
The igloo made by Inuit is surprisingly habitable in extreme cold.
This tiny apartment is barely habitable for a family of pandas.
After renovating, the old warehouse became perfectly habitable.
Earth happens to be in the Goldilocks habitable zone of our solar system.

examples.sentence: Pandas' natural habitat is bamboo forests in Sichuan.
The new aquarium recreates tropical fish habitats with 4D effects.
This valley served as the habitat for ancient tribes.
Urban foxes are changing their habitats to rooftops.
The Gobi Desert is the natural habitat of camel thorns.
Scientists discovered a new mushroom habitat in subway tunnels.
Tokyo's Akihabara is a habitat for anime lovers worldwide.
The app became a digital habitat for meme creators.
Zoos try to simulate animals' natural habitats.
Habitat loss is the main threat to Siberian tigers.

examples.sentence: The cave shows signs of ancient human habitation with leftover fire pits.
Panda habitation requires abundant bamboo and quiet environment.
Her tiny habitation in Shanghai is decorated with 100 potted plants.
The floating habitation on the river has a rooftop hotpot station.
Mars long-term habitation remains a sci-fi dream for now.
His habitual morning routine includes scrolling Douyin while brushing teeth.
The habitual tea drinker carries a thermos everywhere like a security blanket.
The CEO's habitual late-night meetings became legend in the company.
Her habitual seat by the window was respected by all colleagues.
Such delays are habitual during Spring Festival travel season.
His habitual modesty made him refuse all interview requests.
The pickpocket was identified as a habitual criminal with 50+ offenses.
Nail-biting is his habitual behavior when watching suspense movies.

examples.sentence: He habitually checks his phone the moment he wakes up.
The panda habitually rolls down slopes after eating.
She habitually wears red during Spring Festival.
The old bookstore habitually plays jazz at midnight.
New Yorkers habitually ignore street performers.
We habitually overorder at hotpot restaurants.
The professor who habitually late always blames the traffic.

examples.sentence: Panda caretakers habituate cubs to bamboo diets gradually.
Living in Tibet habituated him to high-altitude conditions.
The VR game habituates players to zero-gravity environments.
Flight simulators habituate pilots to emergency procedures.
It takes time to habituate to inverted sleep schedules.

examples.sentence: The habituation to spicy food requires gradual exposure like building tolerance to Sichuan hotpot.
Panda cubs undergo habituation training before meeting tourists.
His habituation of checking WeChat every 3 minutes worries his girlfriend.
The habituation to night owl lifestyle is hard to break.
After 10 years in Beijing, her habituation to the local dialect surprises even taxi drivers.
The pianist's habituation to the instrument makes her play blindfolded.
The habituation effect explains why TikTok users keep scrolling endlessly.

examples.sentence: The tequila-producing hacienda covers 500 football fields.
We rode horses through the olive groves of the ancient hacienda.
Her courtyard replicates Mexican hacienda style with terracotta tiles.
The lumberjack made a clean hack through the pine trunk.
Ancient warriors would test swords by making hacks on stone pillars.
The antique table had mysterious hacks from pirate battles.
New York yellow hacks are iconic movie symbols.
His persistent hack worried the phoenix caretaker.
The chef hacked the watermelon with theatrical flair.
He hacks his Tesla during off-hours.
The panda emoji was used when hackers hacked into the zoo's system.
The hacker stole celebrity photos from iCloud like picking peaches.
Bank systems need firewalls to block hackers.
Linux was created by hackers who love sharing codes.
Real hackers can make a robot with instant noodles packets.
White-hat hackers help companies find security bugs.
Hacker culture values freedom and creativity.
The celebrity's Weibo account was compromised by hacking.
Hacking into campus networks to alter grades is a serious crime.
Tech companies hire experts in ethical hacking to test system vulnerabilities.
Learning basic hacking skills can help you protect your social media accounts.
The grandma skillfully hackled flax fibers to prepare for weaving.
Hackling hemp is like combing a giant's tangled beard.
The rookie chef hackled the vegetables into uneven chunks.
He hackled at the frozen pork like a woodcutter.
The broken mirror showed spiderweb hackles radiating from the center.
Hackles on the ancient sword revealed its battle history.
The flax fibers were pulled through the hackle's metal teeth.
Traditional hackles look terrifyingly like medieval torture devices.
The rooster's hackles stood up when it saw the rival.
Peacock hackles shimmer with iridescent colors during mating displays.
The comment about his cooking got the chef's hackles up.
Nothing gets my mom's hackles up like seeing socks left on the sofa.
We hackled through the dense crowd at the night market.
The nobleman rode a Hackney through Covent Garden.
Hackneys were the Uber of Victorian London.
Dickens often described hackneys clattering over cobblestones.
Taking a hackney cost two shillings per mile in 1850s.
He hackneyed his carriage to tourists near Westminster Abbey.
Inns that hackneyed horses displayed a special license.
Don't hackney your staff like medieval serfs.
The phrase 'big data' has been hackneyed to death.
Hackney coaches had yellow wheels by law.
His hackneyed jokes made everyone groan.
The movie relied on hackneyed plot devices.
Black cabs are officially called Hackney Carriages.

examples.sentence: The phrase 'think outside the box' has become so hackneyed in business meetings.
Her speech was full of hackneyed expressions like 'at the end of the day'.
The hackneyed plot of the drama made audiences yawn.
Avoid using hackneyed metaphors like 'light as a feather'.
His hackneyed jokes about mothers-in-law embarrassed everyone.
The movie's hackneyed ending involved a sudden inheritance.
CVs with hackneyed phrases like 'team player' get deleted first.
The carpenter grabbed a hacksaw to trim the metal pipe.
A hacksaw with rainbow-colored handle is hanging in the toolbox.
Prison break scenes always feature improvised hacksaw blades.
This hacksaw can cut through coins like butter.
The British love dipping haddock in tartar sauce with their chips.
This Icelandic haddock smells as fresh as Arctic sea breeze.
Scottish breakfast always includes golden smoked haddock.
The secret of this chowder is applewood-smoked haddock.
